document_data.name: Ian Cockburn
document_data.mainbody: '''Ian Cockburn''' was a shopkeeper in [[Phlan]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Activities: Ian was the owner of [[Cockburn's Grocery|the eponymous grocery shop]] located in the residential district.
document_data.Personality: Ian was a welcoming man with a wide smile. He was known for his fair prices, but wasn't one to bargain much.
document_data.Possessions: Cockburn was in possession of, and possessed by, a strange artifact which he found in his cellar. When the artifact overtook him, the shopkeeper felt the irresistible impulse to kill. He usually satisfied this need on unsuspecting [[adventurer]]s—but on one occasion killed his wife, which he was openly grieving.
